dialogue.speaker: Luminary Cartographer
dialogue.text: The auroral stormfront refuses to stay mapped. Every dusk the ley-lines redraw themselves.

dialogue.speaker: Luminary Cartographer
dialogue.text: If you can anchor a beacon near the western ridge, I could finally trust a chart for more than an hour.

dialogue.speaker: Luminary Cartographer
dialogue.text: The phantoms aren't the source. Something subterranean is forcing mana upward like steam through vents.

dialogue.speaker: Luminary Cartographer
dialogue.text: Every scout I've sent returns deafened by thunder. Bring resonant wards if you plan to investigate.

dialogue.speaker: Luminary Cartographer
dialogue.text: When the beacon is lit, I'll transmit safe passages to the guild board. You'll save countless operatives time.

dialogue.speaker: Stormbound Sentinel
dialogue.text: Hold, operative. The ridge ahead is a phantasm crucible. Only heartbeats anchored to purpose survive.

dialogue.speaker: Stormbound Sentinel
dialogue.text: Sync your breathing to the aurora pulses. When the sky flashes violet, strike. When it dims, defend.

dialogue.speaker: Stormbound Sentinel
dialogue.text: Phantoms ignore steel but loathe resonance. Aether bells, tuning forksâ€”anything that sings against the gale.

dialogue.speaker: Stormbound Sentinel
dialogue.text: Confidence is a torch. Pride is dry tinder. Know which one you're holding before the wind arrives.
